title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:24 <lpereira> has quit  
00:24 <pgmjsd> has quit  
03:38 <DrLou> has quit  
03:39 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
06:07 <sdumitriu> has quit  
06:08 <cjdelisle> has quit  
06:11 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
07:01 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis1> has quit  
08:09 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <vmassol> mflorea: hi  
09:35 <vmassol> I realized that we haven't committed the title thing for app within minute yet, right?  
09:35 <+mflorea> nop  
09:35 <vmassol> nop = it's been committed ?  
09:36 <+mflorea> it wasn't  
09:36 <vmassol> ok, what's the plan?  
09:36 <+mflorea> to work on it after I finish with the sheet doc  
09:37 <vmassol> but do we agree that we must have it in 3.2?  
09:37 <+mflorea> yes  
09:37 <vmassol> (which means today...  
09:37 <vmassol> )  
09:37 <vmassol> :)  
09:37 <vmassol> since RC1 is Monday….  
09:37 <+mflorea> yes, there is the weekend also  
09:37 <+mflorea> :)  
09:38 <vmassol> yeah, usually to leave it to relaxing activities though… ;)  
09:38 <vmassol> s/usually/usually best/  
09:38 <vmassol> I'd recommend moving the sheet doc after  
09:38 <+mflorea> sure. I'll start today and I'll try to finish by monday  
09:38 <vmassol> are there some votes to send/agree on?  
09:39 <+mflorea> no, I don't think so  
09:40 <vmassol> ok cool then  
10:09 <vmassol> grr…. build is stuck again on ui tests  
10:09 <vmassol> "started 14 hours ago..."  
10:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: if you can have a look when you get some time: the cluster tests are failing: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster/  
10:10 <vmassol> stopping ui job  
10:10 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <+lucaa> hi all  
10:10 <vmassol> hi lucaa  
10:10 <+lucaa> do you know how I can sort the results returned by a lucene search?  
10:11 <+lucaa> in xwiki  
10:11 <+lucaa> e.g. alphabetically  
10:11 <vmassol> you might want to come back in 5 hours… ;) (jioking)  
10:11 <+lucaa> ?  
10:11 <vmassol> sergiu is waking up then  
10:11 <+lucaa> why?  
10:11 <+lucaa> ah  
10:11 <+lucaa> I thought you;ll code it in the mean time  
10:11 <+lucaa> :)  
10:12 <vmassol> hehe  
10:12 <vmassol> we're just waiting for him  
10:12 <vmassol> we're not coding, he does it all  
10:12 <vmassol> ;)  
10:12 <vmassol> ok let me try  
10:12 <vmassol> you get a List and you want to sort it?  
10:12 <vmassol> (that's easy)  
10:14 <vmassol> found:     public SearchResults getSearchResults(String query, String sortField, String languages)  
10:15 <vmassol> in LucenePluginApi  
10:15 <vmassol> there's even: public SearchResults getSearchResults(String query, String[] sortField, String languages)  
10:15 <vmassol> (to sort on several fields)  
10:15 <+lucaa> I wanted to just pass stuff in query string to the search page  
10:15 <+lucaa> so I'll checkout the search page  
10:18 <+lucaa> yep found it  
10:18 <+lucaa> apparently we pass an empty string to that  
10:41 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki

10:42 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <JuanDaugherty> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> found a blocker bug  
10:47 <vmassol> (I tihnk)  
10:47 <vmassol> but I need confirmation  
10:47 <vmassol> the spotlight serch doesn't work anymore for me  
10:47 <vmassol> let me try to clean my cache  
10:55 <vmassol> ok it's broken for me  
10:55 <vmassol> can someone confirm?  
10:58 <vmassol> anyone here?…  
11:02 <vmassol> anyone not sleeping here? I know we're Friday but still!  
11:07 <vmassol> sburjan`: are you testing XE 3.2M3 ?  
11:12 <vmassol> tmortagne confirmed the issue, I've created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7020  
11:21 <sburjan`> I was at lunch  
11:22 <vmassol> hope you had a good lunch :)  
11:22 <sburjan`> :)  
11:23 <sburjan`> vmassol: affects 3.2M2 or 3.2M3 ?  
11:23 <vmassol> M3 at least  
11:23 <vmassol> maybe M2 or earlier too  
11:24 <vmassol> (if you're talking about the spotlight search)  
11:24 <sburjan`> yes, about that  
11:25 <sburjan`> because I see you've put affects 3.2M2 instead of 3.2M3  
11:25 <vmassol> ah my bad  
11:25 <vmassol> ixed  
11:26 <sburjan`> ;)  
11:26 <sburjan`> fyi, I am testing M3 on FF7  
11:27 <vmassol> any problem so far?  
11:28 <sburjan`> nope. but I have reported 2 issues Wednesday, but not related to FF 7  
11:39 <vmassol> has quit  
11:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <heeere> has joined #xwiki  
13:29 <evalica> has quit  
13:58 <heeere> (Rémi) Hi, I just started managing a xwiki (3.1) instance and I have a quick question : is there any way to have an RSS feed list all changes with a diff directly inside the RSS feed?  
13:59 <tmortagne> heeere: you can watch the whole wiki and then go to your profile page -> Watchlist and get the RSS link  
14:00 <tmortagne> you will also receive mail I think if you mail is setup  
14:00 <heeere> ok thanks, I'll try that  
14:00 <tmortagne> you can probably disabled that I guess if you really want just RSS  
14:00 <heeere> ok  
14:02 <tmortagne> we got "# There is insufficient memory for the Java Runtime Environment to continue." again on agent 3  
14:03 <pturcotte> has quit  
14:04 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: coud you cehck the memory we have set and increase it may  
14:10 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <tmortagne> 1024m  
14:10 <tmortagne> for hudson  
14:10 <tmortagne> seems a lot already  
14:10 <tmortagne> not sure if the issue is with jenkins or maven  
14:10 <vmassol> yes  
14:14 <tmortagne> btw it's not a outofmemory but a faling malloc which it supposed to mean that the system itself did not have enough memory  
14:15 <heeere> (about rss) I am now trying to use the WatchListRss but it gives me sql exceptions in the RSS file.  
14:15 <heeere> (about rss) I am running on the hsqldb version in case this might be a source of know limitations.  
14:16 <tmortagne> heeere: I don't know very well RSS feature of watchlist sorry but if you get sql error it definitely looks like a bug and it should work on hsqldb since that's the default distribution database  
14:16 <tmortagne> could you report it on jira.xwiki.org ?  
14:17 <heeere>  ok, no problem  
14:17 <tmortagne> at worst you could use mail instead of RSS until you find a workaround  
14:17 <heeere> I'll do that thanks.  
14:17 <tmortagne> the mail is very nice ;)  
14:19 <lucaa> hi devs, do you know how to group together 2 lucene searches? I tried with OR (keyword OR keyword) but doesn't seem to work  
14:20 <lucaa> is this a known bug?  
14:20 <lucaa> group together == get results from both  
14:22 <tmortagne> you sure it's the right lucene syntax ?  
14:22 <tmortagne> pretty sure it's used to be possible to put several condition in the lucene search  
14:23 <tmortagne> but I don't know about the OR  
14:23 <lucaa> I think I saw that on our page of doc  
14:24 <lucaa> there http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Search+Application+Query+Syntax#HBooleanOperators  
14:24 <lucaa> but I tried with a space too  
14:24 <lucaa> if I put the 2 words separately, it finds a result for each  
14:24 <lucaa> if I put them together, it only shows the result for the second word  
14:25 <tmortagne> seems to work well on xwiki.org  
14:25 <tmortagne> at least I get more result with both that only one  
14:25 <tmortagne> with OR too  
14:25 <tmortagne> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Search?text=vincent+OR+thomas&wikinames=&space=  
14:26 <tmortagne> what version are you using ?  
14:26 <lucaa> huh?  
14:26 <lucaa> where on xwiki org?  
14:26 <lucaa> I tried vincent  
14:26 <lucaa> 82 results  
14:26 <lucaa> vincent OR thomas => 52  
14:27 <lucaa> thomas alone => 52  
14:27 <tmortagne> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Search?text=vincent+OR+thomas&wikinames=&space= give me 147 results  
14:27 <lucaa>  thomas OR vincent => 82  
14:27 <tmortagne> maybe it's a right issue  
14:27 <tmortagne> are you admin ?  
14:27 <tmortagne> on xwiki.org  
14:27 <lucaa> i'm not logged in  
14:28 <tmortagne> sounds like a right related bug then  
14:28 <tmortagne> at least in 2.6  
14:28 <lucaa> wow, it behaves totally different when I'm logged in  
14:29 <lucaa> but what's odd is that on my instance I am admin and logged in  
14:30 <lucaa> i'm on 3.1 btw  
14:31 <lucaa> ahahah, I knew it  
14:31 <lucaa> you need to add a bunch of () around the query  
14:31 <lucaa> I also filter the space  
14:31 <lucaa> and that must be it  
14:32 <lucaa> that the query building doesn't add these parantheses  
14:32 <lucaa> and yes, when I'm not logged in, there must be some default space filtering that comes in  
14:32 <lucaa> on xwiki.org I mean  
14:34 <lucaa> yep ,that's it, if  I logout from xwiki org but put parantheses around the query I get more results than with just one query term  
14:34 <tmortagne> ok  
14:34 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
15:47 <vmassol> has quit  
16:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
16:55 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
16:57 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
16:57 <fmancinelli> is now known as <xenon75>  
17:17 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:19 <vmassol> who can upgrade myxwiki to latest 3.2 snapshot?  
17:27 <@sdumitriu> lucaa: Works correctly on a clean 3.2 Snapsot  
17:28 <@sdumitriu> xwiki.org has a custom query  
17:28 <@sdumitriu> Maybe it doesn't concat things correctly  
17:31 <cjdelisle> I can now  
17:37 <lucaa> sdumitriu: I reproduced the same issue locally on a 3.1  
17:38 <lucaa> maybe it was fixed on the 3.2  
17:38 <lucaa> but it's fine, I'm building my own queries (only add links to them) and I can put my own parantheses  
17:42 <jvdrean> has quit  
17:51 <vmassol> cjdelisle: great  
18:03 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:20 <sburjan`> has quit  
18:22 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
18:28 <xenon75> has quit  
18:35 <vmassol> good news: xwiki commons 3.2M3 is now on Maven Central: http://repo2.maven.org/maven2/org/xwiki/ Champagne! :)  
18:36 <+sburjan`> is this the first version of COmmons to be on MVN Central ?  
18:36 <vmassol> and we now have an automated sync to central set up on sonatype's repo  
18:36 <vmassol> yes  
18:36 <vmassol> going to work on making rendering 3.2M3 available too now  
18:36 <+sburjan`> and we have platform and enterprise on MVN central, right ?  
18:36 <vmassol> no  
18:36 <vmassol> the goal is to have only commons and rendering  
18:36 <vmassol> (for now)  
18:36 <+sburjan`> I see  
18:37 <+sburjan`> I understand rendering, because it can be reused in other projects not related to XWiki  
18:37 <+sburjan`> what about commons ?  
18:37 <vmassol> I'll wait till we have rendering to start some buzz about it ;)  
18:37 <vmassol> commons is needed by rendering  
18:37 <+sburjan`> I see  
18:37 <vmassol> and can be used by any projects  
18:37 <vmassol> (not related to xwiki)  
18:37 <+sburjan`> nice ! :)  
18:37 <vmassol> (even less than rendering)  
18:37 <+sburjan`> not familiar with commons, don't know its role  
18:37 <+sburjan`> \*its  
18:37 <vmassol> http://commons.xwiki.org/  
18:38 <vmassol> we're missing a bit of doc for it … ;)  
18:39 <vmassol> sburjan`: for ex our component system is in commons  
18:39 <vmassol> and can be used by any project  
18:40 <+sburjan`> I see.  
19:26 <cjdelisle> myxwiki restarting
